decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with creatures like Scrapwork Mutt and Stinkweed Imp using cards like Satyr Wayfinder and Circle of the Land Druid. The objective is to then bring back powerful creatures like Lotleth Giant and Molten Gatekeeper from the graveyard using Dread Return. Malevolent Rumble can provide a board wipe if needed, while cards like Generous Ent and Rubblebelt Maverick help ramp up mana production. The combo utilizes reanimation strategies to overwhelm the opponent with big threats and win the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifact creatures and sacrificing them to deal direct damage to the opponent. It includes cards that allow for card draw and mana ramp, as well as removal and combat tricks to control the board. The goal is to flood the board with efficient artifact creatures, then use cards like Makeshift Munitions and Galvanic Blast to finish off the opponent quickly. The deck also includes ways to recycle artifacts and generate extra value from sacrificing them. It aims to win through aggressive plays and card advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to use Balustrade Spy to mill the entire deck, then use Dread Return to bring back a creature like Lotleth Giant to deal a large amount of damage to the opponent in a single turn. The deck utilizes ramp creatures like Overgrown Battlement and Saruli Caretaker to quickly generate mana and draw spells like Winding Way and Lead the Stampede to dig for combo pieces. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Mesmeric Fiend and Masked Vandal to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build up a board of small, low-cost creatures (aggro) in white color that can attack early and often (weenie white). These creatures are supported by a variety of enchantments and auras that enhance their abilities and make them more difficult to deal with. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures while protecting them with various enchantments and combat tricks to ensure victory through aggressive tactics.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while generating value through sacrificing creatures and reusing graveyard resources. It aims to control the board with removal spells and creatures while also gaining card advantage using cards like Ichor Wellspring and Campfire. The goal is to outvalue the opponent by constantly recycling resources and overwhelming them with powerful threats. The deck's strength lies in its ability to grind out games and outlast opponents through attrition and resource management.

The focus of this deck is to quickly build up board presence with efficient, low-cost creatures and enchantments like Arbor Elf, Avenging Hunter, and Jewel Thief. The strategy revolves around using ramp spells such as Utopia Sprawl and Wild Growth to accelerate mana production and play threats ahead of schedule. The deck also includes removal spells like Ram Through and Malevolent Rumble to clear the way for attacks. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive Gruul aggro strategy.

The focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence and control the game using cheap spells like Counterspell and Spellstutter Sprite. Using evasive creatures like Moon-Circuit Hacker and Ninja of the Deep Hours, the deck aims to not only deal damage to the opponent but also draw cards and maintain card advantage. By utilizing disruptive elements like Force Spike and Brinebarrow Intruder, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and secure a quick victory through aggressive play and tempo advantage.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy by using low-cost spells and creatures to control the board and deal damage quickly. The focus is on using card draw and counterspells to maintain tempo and disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also efficiently deploying threats like Delver of Secrets and Cryptic Serpent to apply pressure. Sleep of the Dead can provide a finishing blow, while Deep Analysis provides additional card advantage. The deck's strength lies in its ability to rapidly deploy threats and control the game.

This deck focuses on quickly swarm the board with low cost White creatures and utilizing cards like Battle Screech to generate tokens for aggressive attacks. It also includes cards like Prismatic Strands for protection and removal options like Journey to Nowhere. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a large number of small creatures and maintain board presence with cards like Kor Skyfisher. Additionally, it includes a few utility creatures like Raffine's Informant and Spider-Man, Web-Slinger for additional value and versatility.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using a combination of aggressive creatures and burn spells. By playing low-cost creatures like Sneaky Snacker and Voldaren Epicure, along with efficient burn spells like Fireblast and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with constant damage output. Highway Robbery and Grab the Prize provide additional ways to push damage through, while cards like Guttersnipe and Kessig Flamebreather help to maximize the effectiveness of spells. With a strong emphasis on fast, direct damage, this deck aims to end the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly and aggressively building up a board presence with efficient creatures and token generation. It utilizes cards like Refurbished Familiar and Writhing Chrysalis to overwhelm opponents with creatures. The deck also incorporates various artifacts and lands to help ramp up and fix mana. There is also removal and graveyard hate included to disrupt the opponent's plans. The key strategy is to apply constant pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with versatile cards.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent using efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures. By combining direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Fireblast with creatures like Kessig Flamebreather and Voldaren Epicure, the deck aims to reduce the opponent's life total as quickly as possible. Additional card draw and creature buffs from Faithless Looting, Highway Robbery, and Grab the Prize help maintain pressure on the opponent. Guttersnipe provides extra reach with additional damage whenever you cast a spell. Overall, the deck prioritizes speed and direct damage to secure victories.

The main focus of this Golgari/Jund Garden deck is to control the game through a combination of removal spells and creature sacrifices. By utilizing cards like Nutrient Block, Eviscerator's Insight, and Pestilence, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain board control. The inclusion of cards like Lembas, Cauldron Familiar, and Troll of Khazad-dûm helps to generate value and provide a sustainable source of threats. With additional tools like Nihil Spellbomb and Golgari Rot Farm, the deck can also disrupt the opponent's graveyard strategies. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through a combination of control and resource management.

This deck focuses on fast and aggressive plays using low-cost creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With a mix of cheap counterspells and card draw, it aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while keeping up the pressure. The main win condition is to build a board presence with cheap threats like Delver of Secrets and Cryptic Serpent, while controlling the game with counterspells and tempo plays. The deck also includes cards like Lórien Revealed and Murmuring Mystic to generate additional threats and maintain board presence.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build a board presence with efficient mana ramp and aggressive creatures, specifically Elves. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flood of creatures and generate card advantage with cards like Lead the Stampede and Winding Way. It also includes some removal and pump spells to maintain tempo and pressure the opponent. The key strategy is to capitalize on the synergy and power of the Elf tribe to push for a fast win.

The main concept of this deck revolves around quickly emptying your hand with low cost spells and efficiently utilizing Delver of Secrets to flip into a powerful threat. By taking advantage of strong card draw and counter spells, players can maintain tempo and pressure their opponent with timely disruption. The Mono Blue Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with cheap but impactful creatures while controlling the game through counterspells and card advantage.
